trans-unit.source: Installs and configures assemblies in the COM+ catalog.
This class cannot be inherited.

RegistrationHelper is used by both the .NET Services Installation Tool (Regsvcs.exe) and the automatic registration steps that are performed on first activation of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.RegistrationHelper"></xref> class.
Installs the named assembly in a COM+ application.

InstallAssembly performs the following steps: registration, generation of a type library, registration of the type library, installation of the type library under the specified application, and configuration of the components contained in the type library.
This method requires the caller to have administrative privileges on the local computer.
The file name of the assembly to install.
The name of the COM+ application to install into.
This parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

If the parameter is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> and the assembly contains a <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ApplicationNameAttribute"></xref>, then the attribute is used.
Otherwise, the name of the application is generated based on the name of the assembly, then is returned.

The name of the output Type Library Exporter (Tlbexp.exe) file, or a string that contains <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the registration helper is expected to generate the name.
The actual name used is placed in the parameter on call completion.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.InstallationFlags"></xref> values.
The input assembly does not have a strong name.
Installs the named assembly in a COM+ application.

<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.RegistrationHelper.InstallAssembly%2A> performs the following steps: registration, generation of a type library, registration of the type library, installation of the type library under the specified application, and configuration of the components contained in the type library.
This method requires the caller to have administrative privileges on the local computer.
The file name of the assembly to install.
The name of the COM+ application to install into.
This parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

If the parameter is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> and the assembly contains a <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ApplicationNameAttribute"></xref>, then the attribute is used.
Otherwise, the name of the application is generated based on the name of the assembly, then is returned.
The name of the partition.
This parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

The name of the output Type Library Exporter (Tlbexp.exe) file, or a string that contains <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the registration helper is expected to generate the name.
The actual name used is placed in the parameter on call completion.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.InstallationFlags"></xref> values.
The input assembly does not have a strong name.
Installs the named assembly in a COM+ application.
This method requires the caller to have administrative privileges on the local computer.
A <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.RegistrationConfig"></xref> identifying the assembly to install.
Uninstalls the assembly from the given application.
The file name of the assembly to uninstall.
If this name is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, it is the name of the application that contains the components in the assembly.
The input assembly does not have a strong name.
Uninstalls the assembly from the given application.
The file name of the assembly to uninstall.
If this name is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, it is the name of the application that contains the components in the assembly.
The name of the partition.
This parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The input assembly does not have a strong name.
Uninstalls the assembly from the given application.
A <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.RegistrationConfig"></xref> identifying the assembly to uninstall.
